data.title: Nuggets' Karl earns 1,000th career win
data.meta_description: TORONTO --- George Karl earned his 1,000th coaching victory, as Al Harrington scored a season-high 31 points and Nene added 26 to help the Denver Nuggets hold off the Toronto Raptors 123-116 on Fridaâ€¦
data.text:
TORONTO --- George Karl earned his 1,000th coaching victory, as Al Harrington scored a season-high 31 points and Nene added 26 to help the Denver Nuggets hold off the Toronto Raptors 123-116 on Friday night.

The seventh coach in NBA history with 1,000 wins, Karl also notched his 900th in Toronto, a 114-107 victory on Dec. 31, 2008.

Karl survived prostate cancer in 2005 and was treated for neck and throat cancer earlier this year, missing the end of last season while undergoing treatment.

"It's unbelievable," Chauncey Billups said. "He's got 1,000 wins and he beat cancer twice. Those are his biggest wins."

THUNDER 97, HORNETS 92

In New Orleans, Russell Westbrook had 29 points and 10 assists, Kevin Durant scored 25 points, and Oklahoma City beat New Orleans.

Serge Ibaka had 18 points and nine rebounds, and Jeff Green added 13 points for Oklahoma City (16-8).

David West had 24 points and 13 rebounds for the Hornets.

BULLS 88, LAKERS 84

In Chicago, Derrick Rose had 29 points and nine assists, and Chicago held off a late rally by Los Angeles.

The Bulls hit eight 3-pointers, three by Rose, who made the shot a key part of his game during the offseason. Reserve swingman Kyle Korver connected on a trio of 3s and scored 13 points for Chicago, which held a 26-13 edge in bench points.

TIMBERWOLVES 109, PISTONS 99

In Minneapolis, Kevin Love had 27 points and 18 rebounds and Darko Milicic blocked a career-high seven shots to lead Minnesota past Detroit.

Luke Ridnour had 20 points and 10 assists, scoring 11 in the fourth quarter to help the Wolves to just their sixth win of the season.

Richard Hamilton scored 26 points.

KNICKS 101, WIZARDS 95

In Washington, Amare Stoudemire had 36 points and 10 rebounds to help overcome his 11 turnovers, and New York won its seventh in a row, beating Washington.

Stoudemire posted his seventh consecutive 30-point game.

PACERS 100, BOBCATS 92

In Indianapolis, Danny Granger scored 18 points to help Indiana beat Charlotte.

Brandon Rush added 16 points and Mike Dunleavy 15. Roy Hibbert had 13 points, 14 rebounds, six assists and three blocks for the Pacers.

Gerald Wallace led the Bobcats with 26 points.

BUCKS 97, ROCKETS 91

In Milwaukee, Andrew Bogut had 24 points, 22 rebounds and blocked five shots to lead Milwaukee over Houston..
